title: FF Screen Matrix
content:
[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018075527/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018075527/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Typefaces) : FF Screen Matrix

Designed by [Cornel Windlin](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018075527/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Cornel%20Windlin) and [Stephan Müller](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018075527/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Stephan%20M%C3%BCller), 1994-95  
Released by [FontFont](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018075527/http:/typophile.com/wiki/FontFont)

FF Screen Matrix was originally designed for the Visualize The Future exhibition at the Parco Gallery in Tokyo. A set of posters imitating displays of cash dispenser machines prompted the viewer with a set of statements and questions about his/her lifestyle. The font was initially designed to imitate an existing LCD display and has now been redesigned and extended by Stephan Müller.
